text.content:
Welcome to Pillar 4: Communication and Language Development.

Long before babies can talk, they are able to communicate with the important people in their lives.

These earliest forms of communication are:
  • Important for communicating needs
  • The foundation for relationship development with parents and caregivers

This pillar is designed to teach professionals how:
  • Children develop language and literacy skills
  • Parents can help maximize language and literacy development

Goals of Pillar 4:

Understand the importance of early communication, language development, and literacy.

Understand the research connection between literacy and lifelong success.

Teach skills to parents for increasing communication, print awareness, and early reading.

Identify the key messages to teach to parents.

graphic.notes: graphic of the four pillars with pillar4 highlighted

audio.transcript: Welcome to Pillar 4: Communication and Language Development. Long before babies can talk, they are able to communicate with the important people in their lives. In fact, babies are born communicating, as evidenced by their first cries just moments after birth.

While these earliest forms of communication are important for communicating needs, they are also the foundation for relationship development with parents and caregivers. Over the first five years, children develop the ability to communicate non-verbally, verbally, and eventually through reading and writing. All of these skills develop for each child at his or her own pace.

This pillar is designed to teach you how children develop language and literacy skills, and how parents can help maximize language and literacy development. This pillar will also introduce you to key concepts that we will cover in the Early Communication, Verbal Development, and Emergent Literacy modules. These modules are presented in chronological order according to how children typically develop language and communication skills.

By the end of the Communication and Language Development pillar, you will be able to: 1) Understand the importance of early communication, language development, and literacy. 2) Understand the research connection between literacy and lifelong success. 3) Teach skills to parents for increasing communication, print awareness, and early reading. And 4) Identify the key messages to teach to parents. To begin, click a Topic in the bottom menu.

text.content:
1.

2.

3.

4.

This overview is presented for your own understanding of communication and language development in children.

As you introduce these concepts to parents, it is important to consider their existing knowledge as well as the goal of the learning. Parents may only need to hear the key points and tips rather than the level of detail presented in this module.
